alternative_reference: A 102(b)(7) waiver typically includes language that exculpates directors from monetary liability for breach of fiduciary duty of care. Even though the specific language is not provided in the material, the reservation of Article IX could potentially include such a provision.
reason: The reservation of Article IX in the Certificate of Amendment could potentially include a 102(b)(7) waiver, which would exculpate directors from monetary liability for breach of fiduciary duty of care. Since the language of the reservation is not specified in the material, it leaves room for the possibility of such a provision.
